availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William H. Kerr (Hamilton County, Ohio, prosecuting attorney.)

body.p: Hamilton County, Ohio, attorney. New York native. Married to Harriett E. Scanlan Kerr in Hamilton County, Ohio, on December 19, 1860. Father of Henry S. Kerr. Attorney in Cincinnati in 1860. Prosecuting attorney in Hamilton County in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati Ward 15, p. 413.
Tenth Manuscript Census of the United States (1880), Population Schedules, Ohio, Hamilton County, Cincinnati, p. 458B.
Ohio Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Hamilton County Marriages, Film 000344481.
"Death of William H. Kerr," The Cincinnati Daily Enquirer (Cincinnati, OH), February 20, 1866, p. 2.
Williams' Cincinnati Directory: Embracing a Full Alphabetical Record of the Names of the Inhabitants of the City, a Business Directory, and a Complete List of the Post Offices of the United States and Territories, June, 1865 (Cincinnati: Williams & Company, 1865).
